summary: How far is far enough for successful social distancing? We take a look at some of the still-developing science behind the practice. A CDC guideline based on historical studies of selected infections says that the area of highest risk is within 3 feet of an infected person. title: Science & Tech Spotlight: Social Distancing During Pandemics
